name: Term Equivalence in Quality Documents
description: Equivalence mapping for terminology in audits and tests

theory.natural_language: In the quality handbook, 'factory acceptance test' is equivalent to 'FAT'. 'site acceptance test' is equivalent to 'SAT'. An audit checklist uses the abbreviation FAT. The report mentions factory acceptance tests explicitly. They refer to the same verification step.

queries.natural_language: Do FAT and factory acceptance test mean the same thing?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. FAT is equivalent to factory acceptance test.

queries.natural_language: Is the audit checklist talking about the same step as the report?

expected_answer.natural_language: Yes. The checklist's FAT matches the report's factory acceptance test.
expected_answer.explanation: audit_checklist MENTIONS FAT âˆ§ FAT EQUIVALENT_TO factory_acceptance_test

expected_answer.natural_language: No. SAT refers to site acceptance, distinct from FAT.
expected_answer.explanation: SAT EQUIVALENT_TO site_acceptance_test; no equivalence to FAT
